title: Week in pictures: 9-15 April 2022
description: A selection of striking images from all over the globe, taken in the past seven days.

title: Merle Oberon: India's forgotten Hollywood star
description: Merle Oberon rose to stardom in the West while furtively hiding the truth of her past in India.

title: Ukraine war: Minesweeping dog helps clear Chernihiv of Russian explosives
description: Patron, a Jack Russell, has so far helped to remove hundreds of explosive devices.

title: 'My cancerous tumour was as big as a kettle bell'
description: Stephanie Coles found a strange lump growing in her stomach area.

title: Chernihiv is silent, after having been under constant attack from Russian forces
description: The Ukrainian city of Chernihiv was under constant attack until suddenly Russian forces withdrew.

title: Covid China: Elderly deaths contradict Shanghai figures
description: Official figures claim there have been no Covid deaths in the current outbreak.

title: Ukraine war: Grandmother 'horrified' by capture of British fighter
description: A British man serving in the Ukrainian marines has been captured by Russian soldiers.

title: Homes for Ukraine: Robert Jenrick takes in Ukrainian refugee family
description: Robert Jenrick is thought to be the first MP to take in refugees under the Homes for Ukraine scheme.

title: Easter travellers face traffic jams and rail disruption
description: Millions of drivers are heading on trips across the UK, while several major train routes are closed.

title: Good Friday weather: UK set for hottest day of year so far
description: Above-average temperatures are expected across parts of the UK as the Easter weekend gets under way.

title: Conor Gallagher: Chelsea boss Thomas Tuchel apologises to on-loan Crystal Palace midfielder for cup block
description: Thomas Tuchel personally apologises to Conor Gallagher after Chelsea block the Crystal Palace midfielder from facing his parent club in Sunday's FA Cup semi-final.

title: China Covid: Clashes in Shanghai over lockdown evictions
description: Residents have been forced from their homes as apartments are turned into quarantine centres.

title: Rwanda asylum seekers: UK could send first people 'within weeks'
description: The UK scheme to send some asylum seekers to Rwanda has been described by critics as "cruel".

title: Burnley sack manager Sean Dyche with eight games left of Premier League season
description: Burnley sack manager Sean Dyche with eight games left of their season in the Premier League.

title: Russian warship: Moskva sinks in Black Sea
description: The warship sank while being towed a day after Ukraine claimed to have hit it with a missile.

title: Man City v Liverpool: 'Mohamed Salah must start at Wembley' - Danny Murphy analysis
description: Mohamed Salah should start for Liverpool in their FA Cup semi-final against Manchester City, and Roberto Firmino has a big part to play up front too, says MOTD pundit Danny Murphy.

title: Jerusalem: Over 150 hurt in clashes at al-Aqsa Mosque compound
description: Violence erupted at the al-Aqsa Mosque compound amid soaring Israel-Palestinian tensions.

title: Joe Root steps down as England Test captain following West Indies defeat
description: Joe Root steps down as England Test captain, citing the "toll" and "impact" the role has had on him.

title: West Ham looking to overcome Man City in Women's FA Cup semi-final
description: Three years after losing to Manchester City in a historic Women's FA Cup final, West Ham are hoping to overcome them to book their place at Wembley.

title: Larsen Roberts: 'Slideathon' in memory of boy with brain tumour
description: Five-year-old Larsen Roberts, who had a rare and aggressive brain tumour, died in 2019.

title: Brain cancer DNA research hopes to speed up diagnosis
description: More than 200 brain tumour patients are taking part in research hoping to yield new personalised treatments.

title: Chester Zoo welcomes birth of 'tiny' rare monkey
description: The tamarin monkey is among the world's most endangered primates, with only about 2,000 in the wild.

title: Harry and Meghan visit Queen on way to Invictus Games
description: The royal couple stopped at Windsor to visit the monarch on their way to the Netherlands.

title: FA Cup semi-finals: Man City-Liverpool & Chelsea-Crystal Palace at Wembley
description: Saturday's FA Cup semi-final between Manchester City and Liverpool is live on BBC One, while Chelsea and Crystal Palace meet on Sunday in the other semi-final.

title: Man City v Liverpool: I should become more selfish - Jack Grealish
description: BBC Sport's Kelly Somers talks to Jack Grealish about his first season at Manchester City after this summer's £100m move.
